boat.name: Pleione
boat.full_description:
A gaff cutter designed by John Leather and built in West Mersea by William Wyatt in 1960, Pleione's hull is mahogany on steamed oak frames. In 1992, she had a new teak deck, cabin and cockpit coaming.

'Pleione' has been a regular attendee of Plymouth Classics and other local events having been nearly lost following accidental damage but saved by the late Mike Hooton of Weir Quay, who helped her owner restore her.

26’ LOD, 32’ LOS, 8.5’ Beam and 4’ Draft, 'Pleione' weighs 4.5 tons. There is full standing headroom in the main saloon providing 2 berths, one adapted as a permanent chart table. Twin berths in the fore-cabin and separate head compartment between saloon and the fore-peak. The cabin is essentially original and retains a warmth and charm, enhanced by traditional equipment – Taylors cooker and cabin heater and paraffin lamps.

She has a Yanmar 2GM 20 hp fitted in 1998.
boat.construction_details: Carvel mahogony on steamed oak, teak decks
boat.short_description: 'Pleione' was built in West Mersea by William Wyatt to a John Leather design in 1960.
